isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Service (1995 through 1999) - SECTION 2: TURBOCHARGERS - INSPECTION - VISUAL INSPECTION

svcproc.title: VISUAL INSPECTION

note.para: DO NOT ATTEMPT TO STRAIGHTEN BENT WHEEL BLADES.

svcproc.para: Visually inspect the compressor impeller and turbine wheel for blade erosion, bending, breakage or deposits. Replace as required.

note.para: Compressor impeller and turbine wheel deposits can be caused by the following:

svcproc.para: HIGH AIR INLET RESTRICTION - which allows oil to transfer from the turbocharger center housing, resulting in oil deposits.
EXCESSIVE OIL CONSUMPTION - resulting in turbine wheel carbon deposits.
ENGINE OVERFUELING - can result in excessive operating temperatures which can cause aluminum components to melt. Such deposits may be found on the turbine wheel if such a failure occurs.
Visually inspect the turbine and compressor housings for evidence of wheel rubbing. Replace the housing(s) as required.
